title: Echoes Under the Archon's Gaze
setting_narration: The air around the colossal Statue of the Seven is cool, a gentle evening breeze sweeping through Mondstadt. Below, the city lights begin to twinkle, a stark contrast to the quiet solemnity of the mountain path. Diluc stands, arms crossed, facing the cityscape, while Kaeya leans casually against a nearby stone pillar, his gaze on his adoptive brother.

segments.text: The wind whispers past the Anemo Archon's statue, carrying the distant sounds of Mondstadt's evening revelry, a stark counterpoint to the quiet tension between the two men.

segments.speaker: Kaeya
segments.line: A beautiful view, isn't it, Master Diluc? One could almost forget all the troubles of the world... or perhaps, remember them with a certain fondness.

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.line: Fondness is a luxury some cannot afford. There are always troubles, Kaeya. Looking away changes nothing.

segments.speaker: Kaeya
segments.line: Ah, but even you, brother, must occasionally gaze back at the past. At moments of warmth. Of... companionship. Before the chill set in.

segments.text: Diluc's posture stiffens imperceptibly. He remains silent, his back still to Kaeya, but his grip on his own arm tightens.

segments.speaker: Kaeya
segments.expression_action: (softly, a rare sincerity in his tone)
segments.line: There were those who saw beyond the formality, weren't there? Who saw the fire beneath the ice, or the heart beneath the mask. Even for a short while.

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.line: Such memories serve only to remind one of what was lost. Or what was never truly theirs to begin with.

segments.text: A brief, heavy silence falls between them, filled only by the rustling leaves and the distant murmur of the city below. The unspoken weight of their shared, complicated past hangs in the air.

segments.speaker: Kaeya
segments.line: Perhaps. But even broken things leave beautiful fragments. A reminder that something good, however fleeting, once existed.

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.expression_action: (gazing out again at the city, a flicker of something unreadable in his eyes)
segments.line: Fragments. Yes. And sometimes, those fragments are sharper than any blade.

segments.text: Diluc says no more, turning back to the city lights. Kaeya watches him for a moment longer, the usual playful glint in his eye replaced by a shared, quiet understanding of old pains.
